definitions.definition: enjoying harming others; morally bad and cruel

examples.text: Police described the killer as ‘a desperate and evil man’.
President Reagan referred to the Soviet Union as the ‘evil empire’.
Her face was full of evil intent.
Kristin smiled a particularly evil smile.
A broad smile hid his evil intentions.

definitions.definition: having a harmful effect on people; morally bad

examples.text: In his speech he described the evil effects of racism.

definitions.definition: connected with the devil and with what is bad in the world

examples.text: It was an ancient charm to ward off **evil spirits**.
She had been deceived by an evil demon.
The rubbish bin was giving off an evil smell.

definitions.definition: the time when you have to do something difficult or unpleasant

examples.text: I’d better go and see the dentist—I can’t put off the evil hour any longer.
If you keep on borrowing, you are only postponing the evil day when you have to pay it all back.

definitions.definition: a person or spirit who is thought to have a good/bad influence over you
an unpleasant drink that is a mixture of different things

wordOrigin: Old English yfel, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch euvel and German Übel.
